headline.main: What We're Watching: One More Night of Swimming

docs.snippet: As the U.S. wraps up another dominant swimming campaign, Michael Phelps goes for one more gold medal before ending his Olympic career. Victor Mather has the latest from London....
docs.abstract: As the U.S. wraps up another dominant swimming campaign, Michael Phelps goes for one more gold medal before ending his Olympic career. Victor Mather has the latest from London.

headline.print_headline: Collision At Home Sends Mets To Defeat
headline.seo: Mets Fall to Padres in San Diego
headline.main: Play at the Plate Dooms the Mets

docs.snippet: With the score tied and Carlos Quentin bearing down on him, Josh Thole could not hold onto the ball, and the Padres went on to defeat the Mets....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; San Diego Padres defeat the New York Mets, 3-1.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the score tied and Carlos Quentin bearing down on him, Josh Thole could not hold onto the ball, and the Padres went on to defeat the Mets.

headline.print_headline: Fish and Haas Advance to Semifinals
headline.main: Fish and Haas Advance to Semifinals

docs.snippet: Mardy Fish and Tommy Haas will meet in the Citi Open semifinals Saturday in Washington, their first matchup since 2007....
docs.abstract: American tennis players Mardy Fish and Tommy Haas will meet in the Citi Open semifinals in Washington, their first matchup since 2007.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mardy Fish and Tommy Haas will meet in the Citi Open semifinals Saturday in Washington, their first matchup since 2007.

docs.snippet: Jermaine Taylor and Calen Carr scored in the first half to lead the Dynamo to a 2-0 win over the visiting Red Bulls, extending Houston’s winning streak to five games....
docs.abstract: Houston Dynamo defeat the New York Red Bulls, 2-0, in major league soccer action.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jermaine Taylor and Calen Carr scored in the first half to lead the Dynamo to a 2-0 win over the visiting Red Bulls, extending Houston’s winning streak to five games.

docs.snippet: The boxing champion Floyd Mayweather Jr. was released from a Las Vegas jail after serving two months of a 90-day sentence for domestic violence, the police said....
